channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: FlowReasoner: Reinforcing Query-Level Meta-Agents
item.description: This paper proposes a query-level meta-agent named FlowReasoner to automate the design of query-level multi-agent systems, i. e., one system per user query.

item.title: KGMEL: Knowledge Graph-Enhanced Multimodal Entity Linking
item.description: However, most existing MEL methods overlook the rich structural information available in the form of knowledge-graph (KG) triples.

item.title: M$^2$AD: Multi-Sensor Multi-System Anomaly Detection through Global Scoring and Calibrated Thresholding
item.description: To address this, we introduce M$^2$AD, a framework for unsupervised anomaly detection in multivariate time series data from multiple systems.

item.title: How Effective Can Dropout Be in Multiple Instance Learning ?
item.description: Due to the gigapixel resolution of WSI, applications of MIL in WSI typically necessitate a two-stage training scheme: first, extract features from the pre-trained backbone and then perform MIL aggregation.

item.title: ReSpec: Relevance and Specificity Grounded Online Filtering for Learning on Video-Text Data Streams
item.description: We propose Relevance and Specificity-based online filtering framework (ReSpec) that selects data based on four criteria: (i) modality alignment for clean data, (ii) task relevance for target focused data, (iii) specificity for informative and detailed data, and (iv) efficiency for low-latency processing.

item.title: Efficient Document Retrieval with G-Retriever
item.description: In this paper, we propose an enhanced approach that replaces the PCST method with an attention-based sub-graph construction technique, enabling more efficient and context-aware retrieval.

item.title: Distribution-aware Forgetting Compensation for Exemplar-Free Lifelong Person Re-identification
item.description: To solve these issues, we propose a novel Distribution-aware Forgetting Compensation (DAFC) model that explores cross-domain shared representation learning and domain-specific distribution integration without using old exemplars or knowledge distillation.

item.title: Roll the dice & look before you leap: Going beyond the creative limits of next-token prediction
item.description: We design a suite of minimal algorithmic tasks that are a loose abstraction of open-ended real-world tasks.

item.title: PIV-FlowDiffuser:Transfer-learning-based denoising diffusion models for PIV
item.description: To reduce the special noise step-by-step, we employ a denoising diffusion model~(FlowDiffuser) for PIV analysis.

item.title: Benchmarking Large Vision-Language Models on Fine-Grained Image Tasks: A Comprehensive Evaluation
item.description: Recent advancements in Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) have demonstrated remarkable multimodal perception capabilities, garnering significant attention.

item.title: NeuGaze: Reshaping the future BCI
item.description: Traditional brain-computer interfaces (BCIs), reliant on costly electroencephalography or invasive implants, struggle with complex human-computer interactions due to setup complexity and limited precision.

item.title: Shape-Guided Clothing Warping for Virtual Try-On
item.description: Despite their promising performance, these methods often lack precise control over fine details, leading to inconsistencies in shape between clothing and the person's body as well as distortions in exposed limb regions.

item.title: EasyEdit2: An Easy-to-use Steering Framework for Editing Large Language Models
item.description: In addition, we provide a demo video at https://zjunlp. github. io/project/EasyEdit2/video for a quick introduction.

item.title: HSANET: A Hybrid Self-Cross Attention Network For Remote Sensing Change Detection
item.description: The remote sensing image change detection task is an essential method for large-scale monitoring.

item.title: Segmentation with Noisy Labels via Spatially Correlated Distributions
item.description: However, in many practical scenarios such as medical imaging and remote sensing, obtaining true annotations is not straightforward and usually requires significant human labor.

item.title: Stop Summation: Min-Form Credit Assignment Is All Process Reward Model Needs for Reasoning
item.description: In this paper, we identify the main cause of PRM-induced reward hacking: the canonical summation-form credit assignment in reinforcement learning (RL), which defines the value as cumulative gamma-decayed future rewards, easily induces LLMs to hack steps with high rewards.

item.title: Uni3C: Unifying Precisely 3D-Enhanced Camera and Human Motion Controls for Video Generation
item.description: To overcome this, we present Uni3C, a unified 3D-enhanced framework for precise control of both camera and human motion in video generation.

item.title: RainbowPlus: Enhancing Adversarial Prompt Generation via Evolutionary Quality-Diversity Search
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) exhibit remarkable capabilities but are susceptible to adversarial prompts that exploit vulnerabilities to produce unsafe or biased outputs.

item.title: Evaluating Judges as Evaluators: The JETTS Benchmark of LLM-as-Judges as Test-Time Scaling Evaluators
item.description: Scaling test-time computation, or affording a generator large language model (LLM) extra compute during inference, typically employs the help of external non-generative evaluators (i. e., reward models).

item.title: CRUST-Bench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for C-to-safe-Rust Transpilation
item.description: We introduce CRUST-Bench, a dataset of 100 C repositories, each paired with manually-written interfaces in safe Rust as well as test cases that can be used to validate correctness of the transpilation.

item.title: CRAVE: A Conflicting Reasoning Approach for Explainable Claim Verification Using LLMs
item.description: To address this, we propose CRAVE, a Conflicting Reasoning Approach for explainable claim VErification, that verify the complex claims based on the conflicting rationales reasoned by large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Exploring $\ell_0$ Sparsification for Inference-free Sparse Retrievers
item.description: With increasing demands for efficiency, information retrieval has developed a branch of sparse retrieval, further advancing towards inference-free retrieval where the documents are encoded during indexing time and there is no model-inference for queries.

item.title: Enhancing the Patent Matching Capability of Large Language Models via the Memory Graph
item.description: In this paper, we propose MemGraph, a method that augments the patent matching capabilities of LLMs by incorporating a memory graph derived from their parametric memory.

item.title: DialogueAgents: A Hybrid Agent-Based Speech Synthesis Framework for Multi-Party Dialogue
item.description: Speech synthesis is crucial for human-computer interaction, enabling natural and intuitive communication.

item.title: TAPIP3D: Tracking Any Point in Persistent 3D Geometry
item.description: We introduce TAPIP3D, a novel approach for long-term 3D point tracking in monocular RGB and RGB-D videos.

item.title: NoWag: A Unified Framework for Shape Preserving Compression of Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) exhibit remarkable performance across various natural language processing tasks but suffer from immense computational and memory demands, limiting their deployment in resource-constrained environments.

item.title: Seurat: From Moving Points to Depth
item.description: Accurate depth estimation from monocular videos remains challenging due to ambiguities inherent in single-view geometry, as crucial depth cues like stereopsis are absent.

item.title: UFO2: The Desktop AgentOS
item.description: Recent Computer-Using Agents (CUAs), powered by multimodal large language models (LLMs), offer a promising direction for automating complex desktop workflows through natural language.

item.title: NTIRE 2025 Challenge on Real-World Face Restoration: Methods and Results
item.description: This paper provides a review of the NTIRE 2025 challenge on real-world face restoration, highlighting the proposed solutions and the resulting outcomes.

item.title: NTIRE 2025 Challenge on Image Super-Resolution ($\times$4): Methods and Results
item.description: This paper presents the NTIRE 2025 image super-resolution ($\times$4) challenge, one of the associated competitions of the 10th NTIRE Workshop at CVPR 2025.

item.title: Mitigating Parameter Interference in Model Merging via Sharpness-Aware Fine-Tuning
item.description: Recently, several research efforts have been made on merging these large models into a single multi-task model, particularly with simple arithmetic on parameters.

item.title: SUDO: Enhancing Text-to-Image Diffusion Models with Self-Supervised Direct Preference Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Self-sUpervised Direct preference Optimization (SUDO), a novel paradigm that optimizes both fine-grained details at the pixel level and global image quality.

item.title: Are Vision LLMs Road-Ready? A Comprehensive Benchmark for Safety-Critical Driving Video Understanding
item.description: Experiments on 14 SOTA VLLMs, ranging from 0. 5B to 72B parameters, reveal significant performance gaps, with no model achieving over 40% accuracy, highlighting critical limitations in understanding complex driving scenarios.

item.title: AlphaZero-Edu: Making AlphaZero Accessible to Everyone
item.description: Recent years have witnessed significant progress in reinforcement learning, especially with Zero-like paradigms, which have greatly boosted the generalization and reasoning abilities of large-scale language models.

item.title: SG-Reg: Generalizable and Efficient Scene Graph Registration
item.description: It significantly outperforms the hand-crafted baseline in terms of registration success rate.

item.title: Talk is Not Always Cheap: Promoting Wireless Sensing Models with Text Prompts
item.description: Wireless signal-based human sensing technologies, such as WiFi, millimeter-wave (mmWave) radar, and Radio Frequency Identification (RFID), enable the detection and interpretation of human presence, posture, and activities, thereby providing critical support for applications in public security, healthcare, and smart environments.

item.title: Reconstruction of angular correlations in the associated top quark and the dark matter mediator production
item.description: For the process of single top quark production within the "simplified model" with a scalar dark matter mediator, a new variable based on angular correlations was presented, for the proper reconstruction of which it is necessary to separate the contributions of two undetectable particles: the neutrino and the mediator.

item.title: CLIP-Powered Domain Generalization and Domain Adaptation: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: As machine learning evolves, domain generalization (DG) and domain adaptation (DA) have become crucial for enhancing model robustness across diverse environments.

item.title: SphereDiff: Tuning-free Omnidirectional Panoramic Image and Video Generation via Spherical Latent Representation
item.description: We extend MultiDiffusion to spherical latent space and propose a spherical latent sampling method to enable direct use of pretrained diffusion models.

item.title: Cross-attention for State-based model RWKV-7
item.description: We introduce CrossWKV, a novel cross-attention mechanism for the state-based RWKV-7 model, designed to enhance the expressive power of text-to-image generation.

item.title: Teach Me How to Denoise: A Universal Framework for Denoising Multi-modal Recommender Systems via Guided Calibration
item.description: However, MMRecs struggle with noisy data caused by misalignment among modal content and the gap between modal semantics and recommendation semantics.

item.title: Template-Based Financial Report Generation in Agentic and Decomposed Information Retrieval
item.description: Tailoring structured financial reports from companies' earnings releases is crucial for understanding financial performance and has been widely adopted in real-world analytics.

item.title: Unconstrained Monotonic Calibration of Predictions in Deep Ranking Systems
item.description: Ranking models primarily focus on modeling the relative order of predictions while often neglecting the significance of the accuracy of their absolute values.

item.title: Visual Consensus Prompting for Co-Salient Object Detection
item.description: Our VCP aims to induce the frozen foundation model to perform better on CoSOD tasks by formulating task-specific visual consensus prompts with minimized tunable parameters.

item.title: InfiGUI-R1: Advancing Multimodal GUI Agents from Reactive Actors to Deliberative Reasoners
item.description: Recent works have begun exploring reasoning in GUI tasks with encouraging results.

item.title: Towards Explainable Fake Image Detection with Multi-Modal Large Language Models
item.description: Progress in image generation raises significant public security concerns.

item.title: Know Me, Respond to Me: Benchmarking LLMs for Dynamic User Profiling and Personalized Responses at Scale
item.description: We hope that PERSONAMEM, along with the user profile and conversation simulation pipeline, can facilitate future research in the development of truly user-aware chatbots.

item.title: FedCIA: Federated Collaborative Information Aggregation for Privacy-Preserving Recommendation
item.description: Based on this new paradigm, we introduce the federated collaborative information aggregation (FedCIA) method for privacy-preserving recommendation.

item.title: DrugGen enhances drug discovery with large language models and reinforcement learning
item.description: One promising algorithm is DrugGPT, a transformer-based model, that generates small molecules for input protein sequences.

item.title: Towards Scale-Aware Low-Light Enhancement via Structure-Guided Transformer Design
item.description: Different from employing pre-trained models for the extraction of semantics or illumination maps, we choose to extract robust structure priors based on illumination-invariant edge detectors.
